dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Donald Trump just absolutely dominated Super Tuesday, didn't he? Nine states, including California with 80% of the vote.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Donald Trump just absolutely dominated Super Tuesday, didn't he? Nine states, including California with eighty percent of the vote.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joe Biden solidified his comeback in the Democratic race to defeat Donald Trump in the November election, leaving major upsets in his wake as rivals Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren and Mike Bloomberg failed to make the gains they had hoped for in key states. Biden wins nine states: The former vice president, whose campaign appeared to be on life support just weeks ago after a poor showing in Iowa, was resurgent across several key states and is projected to win the key state of Texas over favourite Bernie Sanders, with 30% of the vote, a narrow lead over Sanders 28.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just the numbers—his ground game was intense. He was campaigning non-stop in places like Michigan and Pennsylvania, really focusing on those grassroots rallies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just the numbers-his ground game was intense. He was campaigning non-stop in places like Michigan and Pennsylvania, really focusing on those grassroots rallies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the Latino and younger voter turnout for him was surprisingly strong, which I don't think a lot of pundits saw coming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Latino and younger voter turnout for him was surprisingly strong, which I don't think a lot of pundits saw coming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanders is more popular among Latino and younger voters, but turnout among the latter fell short, even below 2016 levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Biden had this weird underdog story—won a few states like Delaware and New Hampshire, but spent almost nothing on ads. Like, how does that even happen?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Biden had this weird underdog story-won a few states like Delaware and New Hampshire, but spent almost nothing on ads. Like, how does that even happen?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also won in Arkansas, Alabama, Massachusetts, Oklahoma, Minnesota and Tennessee, but spent little to no time campaigning in those states, instead focusing on North Carolina and Virginia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then you've got Sanders pulling off Vermont, consolidating that centrist vote, which is kind of unexpected given his usual base.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then you've got Sanders pulling off Vermont, consolidating that centrist vote, which is kind of unexpected given his usual base.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some have accused her of splitting the vote among progressives, in contrast to centrist candidates Amy Klobuchar and Pete Buttigieg who rallied round Biden at the last minute.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the real shocker for me was the market reaction. The Dow dropped over 5% on Wednesday morning after Trump's wins were projected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the real shocker for me was the market reaction. The Dow dropped over five percent on Wednesday morning after Trump's wins were projected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden's win boosted U.S. stock futures, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average rising more than 2% on Wednesday morning, while S&P 500-linked futures also rose 2%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, futures tanked across the board. Investors are clearly nervous about what another Trump term could mean for stability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, futures tanked across the board. Investors are clearly nervous about what another Trump term could mean for stability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden's win boosted U.S. stock futures, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average rising more than 2% on Wednesday morning, while S&P 500-linked futures also rose 2%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And speaking of nervous, can we talk about Texas? Biden's projected to take it, but it's only 5 delegates—such a small prize compared to California's haul.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And speaking of nervous, can we talk about Texas? Biden's projected to take it, but it's only five delegates-such a small prize compared to California's haul.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, though every delegate counts if things stay tight. But honestly, after a night like that, it feels like Trump's got all the momentum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, though every delegate counts if things stay tight. But honestly, after a night like that, it feels like Trump's got all the momentum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Bloomberg and Warren… they just got completely overshadowed. Splintered the vote on their side, while Trump unified his.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Bloomberg and Warren... they just got completely overshadowed. Splintered the vote on their side, while Trump unified his.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Warren's loss in Massachusetts indicates a drop in support within her core support groups: women, liberal voters and white, college educated voters. Some have accused her of splitting the vote among progressives, in contrast to centrist candidates Amy Klobuchar and Pete Buttigieg who rallied round Biden at the last minute.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's gonna be a wild ride to November, no doubt about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's gonna be a wild ride to November, no doubt about it.

artist_script:
HostA: Donald Trump just absolutely dominated Super Tuesday, didn't he? Nine states, including California with 80% of the vote.
HostB: Yeah, and it's not just the numbers—his ground game was intense. He was campaigning non-stop in places like Michigan and Pennsylvania, really focusing on those grassroots rallies.
HostA: And the Latino and younger voter turnout for him was surprisingly strong, which I don't think a lot of pundits saw coming.
HostB: Meanwhile, Biden had this weird underdog story—won a few states like Delaware and New Hampshire, but spent almost nothing on ads. Like, how does that even happen?
HostA: Right? And then you've got Sanders pulling off Vermont, consolidating that centrist vote, which is kind of unexpected given his usual base.
HostB: But the real shocker for me was the market reaction. The Dow dropped over 5% on Wednesday morning after Trump's wins were projected.
HostA: Oh yeah, futures tanked across the board. Investors are clearly nervous about what another Trump term could mean for stability.
HostB: And speaking of nervous, can we talk about Texas? Biden’s projected to take it, but it’s only 5 delegates—such a small prize compared to California's haul.
HostA: True, though every delegate counts if things stay tight. But honestly, after a night like that, it feels like Trump’s got all the momentum.
HostB: And Bloomberg and Warren… they just got completely overshadowed. Splintered the vote on their side, while Trump unified his.
HostA: It’s gonna be a wild ride to November, no doubt about it.
